Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed (fired orange); added white maeander frieze between white band; below, band in added red; exterior: guilloche pattern; below, two bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU22), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios. The sample number is written in ink 'NAU 22' on break (Dupont and Thomas 2008, 78-79). Lemos places this sherd in the Wild Goat Style however, the presence of interior decoration is not consistent with that style. The elaborate interior decoration as well as the exterior decoration are consistent with the Mature Animal Style
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 241, pl. 18, no. 228)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 22)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0623) (phase 2)
